net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.widget.window

Interface UiWidgetAbstractWindow

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AbstractValidatableObject, Accessibility, AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPosition, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadResizable, AttributeReadStringTitle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWritePosition, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteStringTitle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTitle<String>, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractComposite, UiWidgetComposite<UiWidgetRegular>, UiWidgetDynamicComposite<UiWidgetRegular>, UiWidgetMultiComposite<UiWidgetRegular>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    UiWidgetAbstractDialogWindow, UiWidgetMainWindow, UiWidgetPopup, UiWidgetWindow
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDialogWindow, AbstractUiWidgetAbstractWindow, AbstractUiWidgetMainWindow, AbstractUiWidgetPopup, AbstractUiWidgetWindow, UiWidgetCustomAbstractDialogWindow, UiWidgetCustomAbstractWindow, UiWidgetCustomPopup, UiWidgetMainWindowGwt, UiWidgetMainWindowTestImpl, UiWidgetPopupGwt, UiWidgetPopupTestImpl, UiWidgetWindowGwt

    public interface UiWidgetAbstractWindow
extends UiWidgetDynamicComposite<UiWidgetRegular>, AttributeWriteStringTitle, AttributeReadResizable, AttributeWritePosition
    This is the abstract base interface for a dynamic composite widget that represents a window. A window is a rectangular area on the screen that has a border. The top border shows its title and potential icon buttons (e.g. to close the window). The right and bottom border may contain scrollbars as needed and potentially allow to resize the window.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • centerWindow

        void centerWindow()
        This method sets the position of the window, so that it is in the center of the screen. You should set set the size before invoking this method.
